verses.verse: Now Sarah<WH8283> lived<WH9132> <WH1961> one hundred<WH3967> and twenty-seven years;<WH8141> [these were] the years<WH8141> of the life<WH9132> of Sarah.<WH8283>

And Sarah<WH8283> died<WH4191> in Kiriath-arba (that is, Hebron<WH2275>) in the land<WH776> of Canaan;<WH3667> and Abraham<WH85> went<WH935> in to mourn<WH5594> for Sarah<WH8283> and to weep<WH1058> for her.
Then Abraham<WH85> rose<WH6965> from before<WH6440> his dead,<WH4191> and spoke<WH1696> to the sons<WH1121> of Heth,<WH2845> saying,<WH559>
"I am a stranger<WH1616> and a sojourner<WH8453> among<WH5973> you; give<WH5414> me a burial<WH6913> site<WH272> among<WH5973> you, that I may bury<WH6912> my dead<WH4191> out of my sight.<WH6440>"
And the sons<WH1121> of Heth<WH2845> answered<WH6030> Abraham,<WH85> saying<WH559> to him,

"Hear<WH8085> us, my lord,<WH113> you are a mighty<WH430> prince<WH5387> among<WH8432> us; bury<WH6912> your dead<WH4191> in the choicest<WH4005> of our graves;<WH6913> none<WH376> <WH3808> of us will refuse<WH3607> you his grave<WH6913> for burying<WH6912> your dead.<WH4191>"
So Abraham<WH85> rose<WH6965> and bowed<WH7812> to the people<WH5971> of the land,<WH776> the sons<WH1121> of Heth.<WH2845>

And he spoke<WH1696> with them, saying,<WH559> "If<WH518> it is your wish<WH5315> [for me] to bury<WH6912> my dead<WH4191> out of my sight,<WH6440> hear<WH8085> me, and approach<WH6293> Ephron<WH6085> the son<WH1121> of Zohar<WH6714> for me,

that he may give<WH5414> me the cave<WH4631> of Machpelah<WH4375> which<WH834> he owns, which<WH834> is at the end<WH7097> of his field;<WH7704> for the full<WH4392> price<WH3701> let him give<WH5414> it to me in your presence<WH8432> for a burial<WH6913> site.<WH272> "

Now Ephron<WH6085> was sitting<WH3427> among<WH8432> the sons<WH1121> of Heth;<WH2845> and Ephron<WH6085> the Hittite<WH2850> answered<WH6030> Abraham<WH85> in the hearing<WH241> of the sons<WH1121> of Heth;<WH2845> [even] of all<WH3605> who went<WH935> in at the gate<WH8179> of his city,<WH5892> saying,<WH559>

"No,<WH3808> my lord,<WH113> hear<WH8085> me; I give<WH5414> you the field,<WH7704> and I give<WH5414> you the cave<WH4631> that is in it. In the presence<WH5869> of the sons<WH1121> of my people<WH5971> I give<WH5414> it to you; bury<WH6912> your dead.<WH4191>"
And Abraham<WH85> bowed<WH7812> before<WH6440> the people<WH5971> of the land.<WH776>

And he spoke<WH1696> to Ephron<WH6085> in the hearing<WH241> of the people<WH5971> of the land,<WH776> saying,<WH559> "If<WH518> you will only<WH389> please<WH3863> listen<WH8085> to me; I will give<WH5414> the price<WH3701> of the field,<WH7704> accept<WH3947> [it] from me, that I may bury<WH6912> my dead<WH4191> there.<WH8033>"
Then Ephron<WH6085> answered<WH6030> Abraham,<WH85> saying<WH559> to him,

"My lord,<WH113> listen<WH8085> to me; a piece of land<WH776> worth four<WH702> hundred<WH3967> shekels<WH8255> of silver,<WH3701> what<WH4100> is that between<WH996> me and you? So bury<WH6912> your dead.<WH4191>"

And Abraham<WH85> listened<WH8085> to Ephron;<WH6085> and Abraham<WH85> weighed<WH8254> out for Ephron<WH6085> the silver<WH3701> which<WH834> he had named<WH1696> in the hearing<WH241> of the sons<WH1121> of Heth,<WH2845> four<WH702> hundred<WH3967> shekels<WH8255> of silver,<WH3701> commercial<WH5503> standard.<WH5674>

So Ephron's field,<WH7704> which<WH834> was in Machpelah,<WH4375> which<WH834> faced<WH6440> Mamre,<WH4471> the field<WH7704> and cave<WH4631> which<WH834> was in it, and all<WH3605> the trees<WH6086> which<WH834> were in the field,<WH7704> that were within all<WH3605> the confines<WH5439> of its border,<WH1366> were deeded<WH6965> over<WH6965>
to Abraham<WH85> for a possession<WH4736> in the presence<WH5869> of the sons<WH1121> of Heth,<WH2845> before all<WH3605> who went<WH935> in at the gate<WH8179> of his city.<WH5892>

And after<WH310> this,<WH3651> Abraham<WH85> buried<WH6912> Sarah<WH8283> his wife<WH802> in the cave<WH4631> of the field<WH7704> at Machpelah<WH4375> facing<WH6440> Mamre<WH4471> (that is, Hebron<WH2275>) in the land<WH776> of Canaan.<WH3667>
So the field,<WH7704> and the cave<WH4631> that is in it, were deeded<WH6965> over<WH6965> to Abraham<WH85> for a burial<WH6913> site<WH272> by the sons<WH1121> of Heth.<WH2845>
